alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lancaster; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 7:25PM EDT until June 17 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Lancaster County in central South Carolina... Northern Lee County in central South Carolina... Chesterfield County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Sumter County in central South Carolina... Eastern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 725 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cassatt, or 11 miles northwest of Bishopville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Bishopville, Chesterfield, Cheraw State Park, Northeastern Technical College, Cassatt, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Lee State Park, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mt Pisgah, Goodale State Park, Mcbee, Jefferson, Ruby, Patrick, Bethune, Mount Croghan, Lucknow, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School and Cheraw Fish Hatchery. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 101 and 113, and between mile markers 122 and 126. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows.
